record.title: MEASURES READ THE FIRST TIME--S. 2293 AND S. 2294
record.narrative:
MEASURES READ THE FIRST TIME--S. 2293 AND S. 2294 -- (Senate - November 01, 2007)

[Page: S13713]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, it is my understanding there are two bills at the desk, and I ask unanimous consent for their first reading en bloc.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered. The clerk will report the bills by title.
The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (S. 2293) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the individual alternative minimum tax, and for other purposes.
A bill (S. 2294) to strengthen immigration enforcement and border security and for other purposes.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I now ask for a second reading and, in order to place the bills on the calendar under rule XIV of the Senate, I object to my own request, all en bloc.
Mr. President, I note the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
